sledgehammer.util

Class TickTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • sledgehammer.util.Printable
      • sledgehammer.util.TickTask

  • public abstract class TickTask
extends Printable
    Class to handle the execution of Tasks that are either one-time executions, delayed executions, or timed executions.
    Author:
    Jab

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Description copied from class: Printable
        Grabs the name of the instance. This is used for the header of prints and printlns.
        Specified by:
        getName in class Printable
        Returns:
        Returns the name of the Printable.

      • runTask

        public boolean runTask()
        Executes a TickTask implementation directly. This is called from the Sledgehammer engine directly, and should not be ran by a third-party, although it can be used in this manner.

        If the TickTask is a timer-task and an Exception is thrown, then the TickTask is cancelled.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the task is a timer-task and has successfully ran. If false is returned, the TickTask is unregistered from the TaskManager.

      • runTask

        public void runTask(Module module)
        Registers and runs the TickTask as a one-time operation.

        Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the following occurs: - The Module provided is null or not loaded.

        Throws an IllegalStateException if the following occurs: - The TickTask is already running.

        Parameters:
        module - The Module to register the TickTask to the TaskManager.

      • runTaskLater

        public void runTaskLater(Module module,
                         int delayTicksStart)
        Registers and runs the TickTask as a one-time operation, with a delayed start.

        Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the following occurs: - The Module provided is null or not loaded. - The delayTicksStart argument is less than 0.

        Throws an IllegalStateException if the following occurs: - The TickTask is already running.

        Parameters:
        module - The Module to register the TickTask to the TaskManager.
        delayTicksStart - The delay in ticks to execute the TickTask the first time.

      • runTaskTimer

        public void runTaskTimer(Module module,
                         int delayTicksStart,
                         int delayTicksTimer)
        Registers and runs the TickTask as timed operation.

        Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the following occurs: - The Module provided is null or not loaded. - The delayTicksStart argument is less than 0. - The delayTicksTimer argument is less than or equal to 0.

        Throws an IllegalStateException if the following occurs: - The TickTask is already running.

        Parameters:
        module - The Module to register the TickTask to the TaskManager.
        delayTicksStart - The delay in ticks to execute the TickTask the first time.
        delayTicksTimer - The interval in ticks to execute the TickTask.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels the TickTask.

        The method throws an IllegalStateException if the TickTask is not running.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the TickTask is used by the TaskManager.

      • run

        public abstract boolean run()
        The execution method for the TickTask implementation.
        Returns:
        The only importance of returning a boolean is for timer-tasks. If true is returned, the timer will keep running. If false is returned, the TickTask will be unregistered from the TaskManager.
